intro: Hesperidopsis circinatus, commonly known as the curled leaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often curled or rolled, giving it its common name. It produces small yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads. Hesperidopsis circinatus is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments.
